SENT.plain: Two cases of pseudo-tandem stenosis of the internal carotid artery are presented
Proximal stenosis was produced by a large, focal atherosclerotic plaque
The severe intracranial "stenosis" was thought to be an angiographic artifact
Repeat cerebral angiography after carotid endarterectomy revealed normal intracranial arteries
The recognition of this entity is important because a decision to operate is based largely upon angiographic findings
